author: Joyce Reynolds, Charlotte Roueché, Gabriel Bodard

resources.description: # All IAph2007 XML files in a downloadable ZIP

organization.description:
Open Archaeology. See the [Working Group on Open Data in Archaeology](http://wiki.okfn.org/wg/archaeology) for more details.

Please note that only open data should be added to this group. Data to enquiry may be tagged "archaeology".

### Metadata

See <http://wiki.osgeo.org/wiki/Location_in_CKAN> for the proposed metadata for both spatial and temporal dimensions. Basically, use meaningful tags.
organization.title: Open Archaeology
organization.name: archaeology

name: inscriptions-aphrodisias
notes:
From the website:

> This is the first edition of the online corpus of the inscriptions of Aphrodisias recorded up to 1994. The editions, translations and commentary are by Joyce Reynolds, Charlotte Roueché and Gabriel Bodard.

> Inscriptions are marked-up using the EpiDoc electronic editorial conventions developed by Tom Elliott and others. The website and the supporting materials were developed by the Centre for Computing in the Humanities, King's College London.
title: Inscriptions of Aphrodisias
